qas.question: How many men did Duquesne send to relieve  Saint-Pierre ?

answers.text: Contrecœur led 500 men south from Fort Venango on April 5, 1754

qas.question: When did British begin to build fort under William Trent?
What was the fort that was being built to be named?
How many women did Duquesne send to relieve Saint-Pierre ?
How many men did Duquesne send to kill Saint-Pierre ?
When didn't British begin to build fort under William Trent?
What was the fort that was being destroyed to be named?
What wasn't the fort that was being built to be named?

context: Even before Washington returned, Dinwiddie had sent a company of <a0_1><a0_2><a0_4>40<a0_2/><a0_1/> men<a0_4/> under William Trent to that point, where in the <a1_0>early months of <a1_1><a1_2><a1_3><a1_4><b5_0>1754<b5_0/><a1_4/><a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> they began construction of a small stockaded fort. Governor Duquesne sent <a0_3>additional French forces<a0_3/> under Claude-Pierre Pecaudy de Contrecœur to relieve Saint-Pierre during the same period, and <a0_0>Contrecœur led <b3_0><b4_0>500<b4_0/><b3_0/> men south from Fort Venango on April 5, 1754<a0_0/>. When these forces arrived at the fort on April 16, Contrecœur generously allowed Trent's small company to withdraw. He purchased their construction tools to continue building what became <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3><a2_4><b6_0><b7_0>Fort Duquesne<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_4/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/>.
